meta.name: Dynamic Media Library with On-demand Downloads for Radarr/Sonarr and Plex

parameters.content:
To-do: 
Controleren of er geen dummy files meer zijn dan pas tag verwijderen.

parameters.command:
=mkdir -p "{{ $('Radarr movie').item.json.path }}"

ffmpeg -ss 0 -i "/mnt/user/Media/Plex/Placeholdarr/dummy-file.mp4" \
  -t {{ Math.min($('Radarr movie').item.json.runtime * 60, 14400) }} -c copy "{{ $('Radarr movie').item.json.path }}/dummy.mp4"

chmod -R 777 "{{ $('Radarr movie').item.json.path }}"
chown -R nobody:users "{{ $('Radarr movie').item.json.path }}"

nodes.name: Create dummy file for series with runtime

parameters.command:
=mkdir -p "{{ $('Webhook Arrs Dummy file update').item.json.body.series.path }}/Season 1"

ffmpeg -ss 0 -i "/mnt/user/Media/Plex/Placeholdarr/dummy-file.mp4" \
  -t {{ Math.min($('Sonarr runtime s01e01').first().json.runtime * 60, 14400) }} -c copy "{{ $('Webhook Arrs Dummy file update').item.json.body.series.path }}/Season 1/Dummy s01e01.mp4"

chmod -R 777 "{{ $('Webhook Arrs Dummy file update').item.json.body.series.path }}"
chown -R nobody:users "{{ $('Webhook Arrs Dummy file update').item.json.body.series.path }}"

=docker run --rm \
  --device /dev/dri \
  -v /mnt/user/Media/Plex:/mnt/user/Media/Plex \
  akashisn/ffmpeg:7.0.2 \
  -hwaccel qsv -f lavfi -i color=black:s=640x480:d=14400:r=1 \
  -loop 1 -t 120 -i /mnt/user/Media/Plex/Placeholdarr/dummy-download.png \
  -filter_complex "[1:v]scale=640:480:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease,pad=640:480:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2:black[img];[0:v][img]overlay=enable='lte(t,120)'" \
  -c:v h264_qsv -b:v 300k -pix_fmt yuv420p \
  "/mnt/user/Media/Plex/Placeholdarr/dummy-file.mp4"

nodes.name: Check if collection is not empty

parameters.content:
## *Arrs Import List for Plex Collection
### You can use either **Trakt.TV** lists or **JustWatch.com** lists to populate your Plex collections.  
### Add a new import list inside your *Arrs application.
### Once set up, choose one of the nodes in **n8n** to retrieve the flow URL (GUID).

### JustWatch Webhook Format

```http://127.0.0.1:5678/webhook/<Node_GUID>/<Provider_ID>/<Count>/<Type>/<Plex_Collection_ID>```


- **Provider_ID**: Leave empty to include all, or use codes like `NFX` (Netflix), `ATP`, `DNP`, `PRV`, etc.
- **Count**: Number of items to fetch.
- **Type**: Use `MOVIE` or `SHOW`.
- **Plex_Collection_ID**: The collection ID in Plex.

---

### Trakt.TV Webhook Format

```http://192.168.1.237:5678/webhook/<Node_GUID>/<Trakt_Username>/<Trakt_List_Name>/<Count>/<Type>/<Plex_Collection_ID>```

- **Trakt_Username**: Your Trakt.tv username.
- **Trakt_List_Name**: The list name, e.g., `watchlist`, `favorites`, or a custom list.
- **Count**: Number of items to fetch.
- **Type**: Use `MOVIE` or `SHOW`.
- **Plex_Collection_ID**: The collection ID in Plex.

---

### *Arrs Settings

In your *Arrs application (e.g., Radarr or Sonarr):

- Add tags: `dummy`, `dummy-unprocessed`
- **Disable** "search on add"
- Set **monitor** to `none`

nodes.name: Get all active sessions for file

parameters.command: =find "{{ $('Webhook Arrs Dummy file update').item.json.body.series.path }}" -maxdepth 2 -type f -iname 'Dummy*' -exec rm -f {} \;

assignments.name: collectionId
assignments.value: ={{   (() => {     try {       return $('Webhook Arrs custom list JustWatch').first().json.params.collectionId;     } catch (e) {       return $('Webhook Arrs custom list Trakt').first().json.params.collectionId;     }   })() }}

assignments.name: objectType
assignments.value: ={{   (() => {     try {       return $('Webhook Arrs custom list JustWatch').first().json.params.objectType;     } catch (e) {       return $('Webhook Arrs custom list Trakt').first().json.params.objectType;     }   })() }}

nodes.name: Wait 5 minutes before process collection in Plex

parameters.content:
## n8n Placeholdarr for Plex (BETA)

### This flow creates **dummy files** for every item added in your *Arrs (Radarr/Sonarr) with the tag `unprocessed-dummy`.
### Its useful for maintaining a large Plex library **without needing the actual movies or shows to be present on your Debrid provider**.

### How It Works
- When a dummy file is played, the corresponding item is automatically **monitored in *Arr** and added to the download queue.
- This ensures that the content becomes available within **~3 minutes** for playback.
- If the content finishes downloading **while the dummy is still being played**, **Tautulli** triggers a webhook that **stops the stream** and notifies the user.

---

### Requirements

- Each n8n node must have the correct **URL** and **authorization headers** configured.
- The **SSH host** (used to create dummy files) must have **FFmpeg** installed.
- A **Trakt.TV API key** is required if you're using **Trakt collections**.

---

### Warning

>  This flow is currently in **BETA** and under active development.  
> It is **not recommended** for users without technical experience.  
> Keep an eye on the GitHub repository for updates.
If your SSH can't run FFMPEG just copy the dummy file to the dummy folder (To-do)

## *Arrs Connect Webhook

Paste the following URL into your *Arrs application under **Notification Triggers**:

- On File Import  
- On File Update  
- On Movie Added  

Set the **Tag** to `dummy-unprocessed` and choose the **POST** method.

---

### Purpose

This webhook triggers a flow that automatically creates a "dummy" file for any new item with the `dummy-unprocessed` tag.

## Tautulli Webhook

Create a new **Notification Agent** in Tautulli and connect it to the following URL.

- **Webhook Method**: `POST`  
- **Trigger**: `Playback Start`  
- **Condition**: Filename contains `dummy`

---

### Payload (Playback Start)

```json
{
  "event": "playback.start",
  "user_email": "{user_email}",
  "user_id": "{user_id}",
  "media": {
    "type": "{media_type}",
    "title": "{title}",
    "show_name": "{show_name}",
    "episode_name": "{episode_name}",
    "season_num": "{season_num}",
    "episode_num": "{episode_num}",
    "year": "{year}",
    "ids": {
      "plex": "{rating_key}",
      "tmdb": "{themoviedb_id}",
      "tvdb": "{thetvdb_id}",
      "imdb": "{imdb_id}"
    },
    "file_info": {
      "path": "{file}"
    }
  }
}
